post_text: It is with great sorrow that we inform you of the passing of our beloved Commissioner Mr. Carl Pennamon on Sunday, September 6, 2020. Mr. Pennamon was among the longest serving Commissioners in the State of Georgia. He served nine (9) terms as a Commissioner for Jasper County in District 1. He was a true example of a dedicated Public Servant. His passing leaves a huge void in our community. We will forever cherish his memories and the sacrifices he made for the citizens of Jasper County and Monticello, Georgia. On behalf of the Board of Commissioners and staff we send our heartfelt condolences to the Pennamon Family.

CODE ENFORCEMENT OFFICER POSITION

Jasper County is accepting applications for a Code Enforcement Officer. This position is responsible for the enforcement of national and state codes and local ordinances adopted by Jasper County. Minimum qualifications include the ability to read, write, and perform basic mathematical calculations at a level commonly associated with the completion of high school or equivalent. Sufficient experience to understand the basic principles relevant to the major duties of the position, usually associated with the completion of an apprenticeship/internship or has had a similar position for one to two years. Preference will be given to candidates that possess certification as a Code Enforcement Officer. For a full job description and application, please come by the Human Resources Department on the ground floor in the Courthouse or visit our website at www.jaspercountyga.org . Deadline to apply is 12:00 p.m. on July 31, 2020. No phone calls please!

PENINSULA UPDATE...

Jasper County Sheriff's Office
September 18, 2019 at 9:32 AM ¬∑

Recently, we were made aware of a potential scam that is being mailed to our residents. The letters come as a sales contract for your property and offers a quick cash sale. The issue is that the contract is for an amount that is substantially less that the value of the property. This contract, if signed and returned, could leave you homeless for a fraction of the value of your property.
Additionally, as we get closer to the end of the year, phone calls from scammers will continue to increase and their demands will get bolder and more creative. Simply put, do not give anyone, any information over the phone, ESPECIALLY your personal information.
NO ONE is legitimately going to settle a real debt with you over the phone in exchange for Itunes or any other kind of gift card. Unfortunately, if you fall victim to one of these scams, the likelihood of ever getting your money back is very low.
